Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of a building.
Every morning he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
When he returns in the evening, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and walks up the stairs to reach his apartment on the 10th floor.
However, on rainy days and when there are other people in the elevator, he goes directly to the 10th floor.

Why does he normally get off on the 7th floor?

The man normally gets off at the 7th floor because he prefers to walk up the stairs from there to his 10th-floor apartment.
In the morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
In the evening, he takes the elevator up to the 7th floor, where it's more convenient for him to walk up the remaining flights of stairs.
On rainy days or when the elevator is crowded, he takes it directly to the 10th floor to avoid walking in the rain or dealing with a busy elevator.
